title.narrative: Mechanism 9976 - Vietnam Administration for HIV/AIDS Control (VAAC)

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
CDC’s collaboration with the Vietnam Ministry of Health (MOH)/Vietnam Administration for HIV/AIDS Control’s (VAAC) will support the Government of Vietnam (GVN) implement the National Strategy on HIV/AIDS Prevention and Control. The mechanism strengthens the technical and organizational capacity of GVN/MOH to: Oversee services targeting PLWHA and key populations. Collect/use epidemiologic data thro Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.6: Adult Care and Support. All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.8: Orphans and Vulnerable Children. Activities are aimed at improving the lives of orphans and other vulnerable children (OVC) affected by HIV/AIDS, and doing so in a measurable way. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.12: Laboratory Infrastructure. Development and strengthening of laboratory systems and facilities to support HIV/AIDSrelated activities including purchase of equipment and commodities and provision of quality assurance, staff training and other technical assistance. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.9: Counseling and Testing. Includes activities in which both HIV counseling and testing are provided for those who seek to know their HIV status (as in traditional VCT) or provider initiated counseling and testing. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.5: Sexual Prevention - Other Sexual Prevention. Other activities (including training) aimed at preventing HIV transmission including purchase and promotion of condoms, STI management (if not in palliative care settings/context), messages/programs to reduce other risks of persons engaged in high-risk behaviors. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.14: Strategic Information. HIV/AIDS behavioral and biological surveillance, facility surveys, monitoring partner results, reporting results, supporting health information systems, assisting countries to establish and/or strengthen such systems, and related analysis and data dissemination activities fall under strategic information. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.7: TB/HIV. Includes exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, treatment and prevention of tuberculosis (including medication), as well as screening and referral of TB clinic clients for HIV testing and clinical care. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.16: Biomedical Prevention - Prevention Among Injecting and Non-Injecting Drug Users. Activities including policy reform, training, message development, community mobilization and comprehensive approaches including medication assistance therapy to reduce injecting drug use. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.1: Preventing Mother-to-Child Transmission (PMTCT). Activities (including training) aimed at preventing mother-to-child HIV transmission, including ARV prophylaxis for HIV-infected pregnant women and newborns and counseling and support for maternal nutrition. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.13: Health System Strengthening. Include activities that contribute to national, regional or district level systems by supporting finance, leadership and governance (include broad policy reform efforts including stigma, gender, etc.), institutional capacity building, supply chain or procurement systems, Global Fund programs and donor coordination. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.17: Pediatric Care and Support. All health facility-based care for HIV-exposed children and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.18: Treatment/Pediatric Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. objectives

CDC’s collaboration with the Vietnam Ministry of Health (MOH)/Vietnam Administration for HIV/AIDS Control’s (VAAC) will support the Government of Vietnam (GVN) implement the National Strategy on HIV/AIDS Prevention and Control. The mechanism strengthens the technical and organizational capacity of GVN/MOH to: Oversee services targeting PLWHA and key populations. Collect/use epidemiologic data through HIV surveillance, treatment, and disease monitoring. Coordinate donors and disseminate technical guidance. VAAC coordinates HIV activities at the national, regional and provincial levels. COP 14 will continue the transition of operational costs from PEPFAR VN/CDC funding support to GVN and other funding. This includes a reduction in provinces supported from the current 28 and continuing to build country-owned technical assistance (TA) via VAAC sub-agreements with 6 national institutes. Strategies for cost efficiencies are: i) Reduction in rates of payment and/or reimbursement for selected cost inputs; ii) integrating current CDC-funded services into GVN healthcare facilities; (ii) improving linkages across the continuum of care iii) narrowing the geographic scope to areas of highest burden. CDC will work with VAAC to provide TA and monitoring of activities. Program monitoring will be conducted through data reporting, a PEPFAR monitoring system, site visits and program reviews. A COP14 priority is modification of monitoring and evaluation systems to ensure monitoring of service delivery in the transition. Pipeline was taken into account when setting the COP 14 budget request. As part of CDC’s realignment, this mechanism will receive a six-month cost extension. Available pipeline will fund the cost extension; making pipeline negligible.

mailing-address.narrative: 2100 Pennsylvania Avenue, Suite 200, Washington, DC 20522, USA

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.
